newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: RESEARCH ALERT - Comercial del Plata upgraded.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Comercial del Plata upgraded.

text.p: Santander Investment said Thursday it upgraded Argentine holding company Comercial del Plata to market perform from underperform citing a "surprisingly high value for its downstream division."
Analyst Fernando Peres wrote in a report that Santander was raising its 12-to-18 month target price to $3.76 from $2.73 per share.

He also said that "owing to a marked decrease in financial expenses, we are raising our 1997 earnings estimate to $175.3 million ($42.3 million excluding extraordinary gains) from $35.8 million; to $49.1 million in 1998 from $39.0 million; and to $58.7 million in 1999 from $47.5 million."
Comercial del Plata a week ago announced it will raise about $330 from several divestitures, including downstream and electricity transmission businesses and half of its construction division.
